title: Why aren't there desperate single women looking for a relationship although you can find guys complaining about being single all the time? Do all the women get partners without having to try? - Quora

response.answer_text: The previous answers were spot-on in pointing out that most women are looking for a relationship, and can usually get meaningless sex in most bars by closing time. Most of the men I hear whining about “being single” are complaining about not being able to get meaningless sex when they want it. There is still a significant social stigma against women who just want sex. Those who might be inclined to complain in a manner similar to the guys get called some pretty nasty names. While both sexes risk sexually transmitted disease, women also risk pregnancy. It is much safer for them to seek more permanent relationships than meaningless sex. But it can be pretty exhausting trying to maintain a relationship with someone who puts up with you because then he has a regular source of sex. So put all that together and you realize that women typically have different factors influencing their desire for relationships and sex. It’s no wonder that they complain about different parts of the whole process.
